title: Organizational Culture & Work Content Survey
source_note: Cleaned and standardized from Qualtrics scrape; placeholder and duplicate questions removed; anchors normalized where implied.

items.question: Email Address
Your company or organization name
Your department name
Your supervisor or manager’s name

pages.title: Organizational Culture: Means, Ends, Innovation & Ethics

items.question: In your organization, the means (moral values) that guide employees are more important than the ends (financial results, profits, growth).
In your organization, employees are rewarded more for achieving financial results than for achieving moral goods.
In your organization, moral behaviour is recognized and rewarded.
Employees are expected to act ethically at all times.
Leadership communicates a moral vision for the organization and acts ethically themselves.
Our organization is successful because we stay in tune with what is going on in our customers’ lives.
Our organization is not afraid of failing at some things if it helps us move forward with new ideas.
It is important that our organization pushes the cutting edge in new ideas and technology.
Employees are asked to take on projects that are not part of their usual roles.
Our organization invests in new ideas even if they will not be profitable for many years.
Innovation is just as important as efficiency.
Our organization invests in long-term research even when the payoff is uncertain.
Our organization cares about our clients, customers or those we serve.
Our organization creates space for employees to balance work, family and personal needs.
Leadership in this organization acts ethically in what they say and do.
On a scale from 1 to 10, how would you rate your organization’s overall effectiveness?
In your current position, how much is building relationships with other people a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would building relationships with other people be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to build relationships with other people at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 2
pages.attribute_label: Receiving training in valuable new skills.

items.question: In your current position, how much is receiving training in valuable new skills a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would receiving training in valuable new skills be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to receive training in valuable new skills at my current job.
In your current position, how much is learning valuable new knowledge a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would learning valuable new knowledge be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to learn valuable new knowledge at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 4
pages.attribute_label: Doing things that help me be a better person.

items.question: In your current position, how much is doing things that help me be a better person a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would doing things that help me be a better person be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to do things that help me be a better person at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 5
pages.attribute_label: Pay and benefits (salary, bonuses, healthcare, retirement, etc.).

items.question: In your current position, how much are pay and benefits (salary, bonuses, healthcare, retirement, etc.) a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would pay and benefits (salary, bonuses, healthcare, retirement, etc.) be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities related to pay and benefits at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 6
pages.attribute_label: Schedule or working location (for example, ability to work remotely, flexible hours or choice of physical location).

items.question: In your current position, how much is schedule or working location a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would schedule or working location be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities related to schedule or working location at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 7
pages.attribute_label: Working toward my dream role or position.

items.question: In your current position, how much is working toward your dream role or position a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would working toward your dream role or position be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to work toward my dream role or position at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 8
pages.attribute_label: Having a direct impact on helping clients, customers or those we serve.

items.question: In your current position, how much is having a direct impact on helping clients, customers or those you serve a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would having a direct impact on helping clients, customers or those you serve be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to have a direct impact on helping clients, customers or those we serve at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 9
pages.attribute_label: Making a direct contribution to the progress of our organization.

items.question: In your current position, how much is making a direct contribution to the progress of your organization a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would making a direct contribution to the progress of your organization be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to make a direct contribution to the progress of our organization at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 10
pages.attribute_label: Being part of a close-knit team.

items.question: In your current position, how much is being part of a close-knit team a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would being part of a close-knit team be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to be part of a close-knit team at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 11
pages.attribute_label: Completing tasks that I find meaningful.

items.question: In your current position, how much is completing tasks that you find meaningful a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would completing tasks that you find meaningful be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to complete tasks that I find meaningful at my current job.

pages.title: Work Content Attribute 12
pages.attribute_label: Making important contributions to meaningful projects.

items.question: In your current position, how much is making important contributions to meaningful projects a part of your job?
If you could build your ideal job right now, how much would making important contributions to meaningful projects be a part of that job?
I wish that I had more opportunities to make important contributions to meaningful projects at my current job.

sections.title: Core Items (1–9 sliders; anchors vary where specified)

items.question: How clear are your team’s expectations to you?
How adequate are the resources (including time) allocated to you to be productive?
If something needs to get done, how likely are you to take it upon yourself to do it even if it is not part of your defined role?
How often do you avoid bringing up touchy subjects for fear of conflict?

sections.title: Team Culture & Psychological Safety (1–9: 1–3 Never/Rarely, 4–6 Sometimes, 7–9 Always)

items.question: People in my team are comfortable owning up to mistakes.
In my team, people treat each other with respect.
We avoid discussing touchy subjects such as pay and politics in my team.
Employees in my team have a strong sense of what our company stands for.
Rules and red tape get in the way of us doing our jobs.
Sometimes colleagues in my team attempt to undermine each other.
On the whole, conflict in my team is productive and not destructive.
It is important to come to an agreement quickly rather than explore conflicting opinions.
Sometimes I avoid asking for help from team members for fear of damaging my reputation.
There are cliques or factions within our team.
If my manager does something that is not allowed, someone will say something.
My supervisor does what they say they will do.
My supervisor sets a good example in terms of ethical behaviour.
If I made a complaint about my supervisor, I feel it would lead to positive changes.
Only people who act with the highest levels of integrity will be considered for promotion.
I sometimes feel pressure to do things in a way that is not entirely ethical.
How negative or positive is your job’s impact on society?
In your ideal job, how important is it that your job has a positive impact on society?
I wish I had more opportunities to have a positive impact on society at my current job.
How small or large of an impact on society does your current job have?
In your ideal job, how important is it that your job has a large impact on society?
I wish I had more opportunities to make a large impact on society at my current job.
Are you of Spanish, Hispanic or Latino origin?
How many years have you worked here?
items.note: Source text showed examples up to 12 years; generator provides 1..50+ for robustness.

items.question: What is the highest level of education you have completed?

options.label: Graduate or professional degree (MA, MS, MBA, PhD, JD, MD, DDS etc.)

items.question: In what field is your Bachelor’s Degree?
In what area of Business & Management was your focus?
Do you have any degrees beyond a bachelors? (Select all that apply)
How many years has it been since you graduated with your Bachelor’s Degree (if you hold one)?
How old are you?
How do you describe yourself?
How many children under 18 live with you?
How many children age 5 or under live with you?
What is your current marital status?
Choose one or more races that you consider yourself to be

options.label: American Indian/Native American or Alaska Native
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

items.question: In what Country or Countries is your citizenship?
In what Country do you currently reside?
Do you work Remote, In-Person, or Hybrid?

pages.title: End of Survey
pages.end_of_survey_message: We thank you for your time spent taking this survey. Your response has been recorded.
